Oh bendita juventud que te has ido para no volver. I got my revenge too. Whenever they took my lunch, I flooded their schoolbags, whenever they left me in the dark room, Iframed them for theft. It was a battle of wits, well, only mine.
Economics. Its fine and all, but it isnt history. Turns out history pays better in my country. And all because i heard the other people.

topics.body:
"@Meresflut":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550e3e3d63687247d18e0300#post_550e3e3d63687247d18e0300
I beg to argue on the philosophy part. Math is the truest language in which the universe is written in. Politics, poetry, philosophy all have a tendency to deviate from the truth. But with math, It is as close as we can get to the word of God!

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550e3fc46368725ab4720a00#post_550e3fc46368725ab4720a00
Mathematics is just a language to express in exact terms what in words could be deceiving. The works of Kantor or Rieman take us to realms far beyond our reality and makes us question it. Mathematics trascend utilitarism and makes us think about the nature of our world. If that isnt philosophy, I dont know what it is.

Not really again.

Math isn't really a language either, Albus. If Math was really focused to a point. If everyone was talking in numbers would you understand it probably not.

The only part of Math that can be good is if you need a shape or something to solve with. Perminter and Area can be solved that way. However if you want a harder problem than 1+1=2. Then stuff like algebra comes to play.
